intro: Bromheadia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine bromhead, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and pinnate leaves that are typically green and glossy. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by ornamental fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
